summary: This is a daily camera status report from the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) Brooklyn, confirming which surveillance cameras in the West and East buildings were operational on August 9, 2019, at 12:30 PM. The document is significant as it provides a snapshot of the facility's security monitoring status around the time of Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration and death.

events.title: Daily Camera Status Report
events.description: A report was generated confirming the operational status of surveillance cameras in the West and East buildings, including the Special Housing Units (S.H.U.), at the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn.

locations: Metropolitan Detention Center (M.D.C.) Brooklyn, Brooklyn, NY 11232
keyFacts: The document is a daily camera status report from the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) Brooklyn, dated August 9, 2019.
It confirms that specific cameras in the West Building (K-81, 82, 83, 84 and West S.H.U.) and East Building (3-N, 3-S, 3-W, and East S.H.U.) were operational at 12:30 PM.
The report was generated by or for an Electronics Technician at the facility, indicating routine security monitoring procedures.
